original: Spring Boot is a Spring module which provides RAD (Rapid Application Development) feature to Spring framework.
result: Spring Boot is a module belonging to the Spring framework that enables the rapid development of applications.

original: It is used to create stand alone spring based application that you can just run because it needs very little spring configuration.
result: Spring Boot is a framework that enables developers to create standalone applications based on the Spring framework. It is designed to require minimal Spring configuration, making it easy for developers to create and run Spring-based applications without much effort.

original: For more information  click here.
result: To access further details, kindly visit this page.

original: Create stand-alone Spring applications that can be started using java -jar.
result: One can develop Spring applications that are independent and can be launched using the command "java -jar".

original: Embed Tomcat, Jetty or Undertow directly. You don't need to deploy WAR files.
result: You can integrate Tomcat, Jetty or Undertow directly into your application without the need to deploy separate WAR (Web Archive) files. This allows for a smoother and more efficient process.

original: It provides opinionated 'starter' POMs to simplify your Maven configuration.
result: This platform offers pre-configured POMs to simplify the Maven setup process, serving as a useful starting point for projects.

original: It automatically configure Spring whenever possible.
result: The feature helps in auto-configuration of Spring whenever feasible.

original: There are multiple approaches to create Spring Boot project. We can use any of the following approach to create application.
result: There are different methods to develop a Spring Boot project. Several options are available to create an application using this framework.

original: Spring Starter Project Wizard
result: The Spring Starter Project Wizard assists in creating new Spring-based projects by simplifying the initial configuration process.

original: Spring Boot CLI
result: Spring Boot CLI is a tool used for building Spring applications from the command line. It allows developers to quickly create and develop Spring Boot applications without the need for an extensive IDE or web interface. The Spring Boot CLI offers a fast and efficient way to create, test, and run Spring applications, making it a popular choice for developers.

result: You can find additional details by visiting this link.

result: Spring offers a web tool on their official site that allows users to create a Spring Boot project by specifying project details. This convenient feature streamlines the project creation process.

original: The @RestController is a stereotype annotation. It adds @Controller and @ResponseBody annotations to the class. We need to import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation package in our file, in order to implement it.
result: The @RestController is an annotation used to define a controller class that is responsible for handling RESTful requests. It combines the functionalities of the @Controller and @ResponseBody annotations. This annotation requires the import of the org.springframework.web.bind.annotation package in order to use it.

result: To obtain additional details, please follow this link.

original: Spring Boot manages dependencies and configuration automatically. You don't need to specify version for any of that dependencies.
result: Spring Boot simplifies dependency management and configuration, taking care of it automatically. The burden of specifying version for dependencies is removed, as this is handled by the framework.

original: Spring Boot upgrades all dependencies automatically when you upgrade Spring Boot.
result: Spring Boot has the capability to upgrade all its associated dependencies automatically when it goes through an upgrade itself.

original: For more information  click here.
result: To obtain additional details, please refer to the following link.

original: Spring Boot provides various properties which can be specified inside our project's  application.properties  file. These properties have default values and you can set that inside the properties file. Properties are used to set values like: server-port number, database connection configuration etc.
result: In Spring Boot, we can configure different properties for our project by specifying them in the application.properties file. These properties come with pre-defined default values but we can modify them as per our requirements. They are used to set values such as the server port number and the configuration for the database connection.

original: For more information  click here.
result: To obtain additional details, please follow this link.

original: Starters are a set of convenient dependency descriptors which we can include in our application.
result: Starters refer to a collection of dependency descriptors that are available for easy inclusion in our application.

original: Spring Boot provides built-in starters which makes development easier and rapid. For example, if we want to get started using Spring and JPA for database access, just include the  spring-boot-starter-data-jpa  dependency in your project.
result: Spring Boot offers convenient starter modules that simplify and speed up development. These modules provide pre-configured dependencies for certain functionality, such as database access with Spring and JPA. This eliminates the need for developers to manually configure these dependencies and enables them to quickly get started with their project.

original: For more information  click here.
result: To obtain further details, please visit the provided link.

original: Spring Boot provides actuator to monitor and manage our application. Actuator is a tool which has HTTP endpoints. when application is pushed to production, you can choose to manage and monitor your application using HTTP endpoints.
result: Actuator is a feature offered by Spring Boot that enables the monitoring and management of the application. It provides HTTP endpoints that can be used to manage and monitor the application in production. This can be useful in ensuring that the application is performing optimally and making any necessary adjustments.

original: It is a server side Java template engine for web application. It's main goal is to bring elegant natural templates to your web application.
result: Thymeleaf is a Java template engine utilized on the server side of web applications. Its primary focus is on providing web applications with aesthetically pleasing and natural templates.

original: It can be integrate with Spring Framework and ideal for HTML5 Java web applications.
result: Spring Framework integration is possible with a Java web application that is HTML5-based. The integration is ideal for developing HTML5 Java web applications.

original: Spring Boot provides  spring-boot-starter-data-jpa  starter to connect Spring application with relational database efficiently. You can use it into project POM (Project Object Model) file.
result: Spring Boot offers a convenient starter called spring-boot-starter-data-jpa that enables easy connection between a Spring application and a relational database. It can be added to the POM (Project Object Model) file of a project.

original: The @RestController is a stereotype annotation. It adds @Controller and @ResponseBody annotations to the class. We need to import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation package in our file, in order to implement it.
result: The @RestController is an annotation that adds both @Controller and @ResponseBody annotations to a class, and it is used in Spring frameworks. To implement it, you'll need to import the org.springframework.web.bind.annotation package into your file.

original: For more information  click here.
result: To access additional details, please follow this link.

original: The  @RequestMapping  annotation is used to provide routing information. It tells to the Spring that any HTTP request should map to the corresponding method. We need to import org.springframework.web.annotation package in our file.
result: In Spring, we use the @RequestMapping annotation to define the route information that maps to a specific method for an HTTP request. This annotation is vital as it provides instructions to the Spring framework on how to route incoming requests. To use @RequestMapping, we must import the org.springframework.web.annotation package into our file.

original: Spring is a web application framework based on Java. It provides tools and libraries to create a complete cutomized web application.
result: Spring is a powerful framework used for building web applications on the Java platform. It offers a wide range of tools and libraries that can be utilized to create highly customized and interactive web applications.

original: Wheras Spring Boot is a spring module which is used to create spring application project that can just run.
result: Spring and Spring Boot are both frameworks that are used for building applications in Java. Spring is a popular framework that provides many useful modules for building enterprise-level applications. On the other hand, Spring Boot is a module of Spring that allows developers to create Spring applications that can run with minimal configuration. It simplifies the process of building and deploying Spring applications by providing a pre-configured environment.
